question: Design a 60-minute squash session to improve my straight game
answer:
Duration: 60 min
Session Focus: Mastering Straight Game Control and Execution
Rest between exercises: 1min 30s

Warm-up  (10 min)
1. 2min 30s: Boast-Drive-Drop-Drive
2. 2min 30s: Boast-Drive 2 shots, keeping same positions
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

Session
Conditioned Game 1 (12min)
• 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives (first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the service line and the service box alley)
Switch roles
• 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives (first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the service line and the service box alley)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 2 (12min)
• 7 points (forehand): Drives No Volleys (Each player must place one foot on the T line after hitting their shot)
Switch roles
• 7 points (backhand): Drives No Volleys (Each player must place one foot on the T line after hitting their shot)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 3 (12min)
• 7 points (forehand): Drives with 1 Drop (first bounce must land behind the service line and inside the service box alley.
Switch roles
• 7 points (backhand): Drives with 1 Drop (first bounce must land behind the service line and inside the service box alley)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 4 (12min)
• 11 points (forehand): Alley Game
Switch roles
• 11 points (backhand): Alley Game
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 5 (6min)
• 11 points: Free Game (if you hit a shot too tight against the wall you win 2 points)

End of session.

Focus: Mastering Deep Straight Game Control with Strategic Integration of Limited Short Attacks.
Rest time between exercises: 1min30sec

WARM-UP (10min)
2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above
SESSION
Conditioned Game 1 (deep only)
First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)
First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)
Conditioned Game 2
First to 9 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)
First to 9 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)

Conditioned Game 3
First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep cross)
First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep cross)

Conditioned Game 4
First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)
First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)

Conditioned Game 5
First to 11 points: Free Game

End of session.

Focus: Mastering the Straight Game through Patterned Play, Strategic Lob-Based Rally Control, and Effective Volley Straight Interception
Rest time between exercises: 1min30sec

WARM-UP (10min)
2min30sec: Boast – Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above
SESSION
Conditioned Game 1 (deep only)
First to 9 points (forehand): Straight Lob – Drive – Drop (rules: Players must follow the sequence)
First to 9 points (backhand): Straight Lob – Drive – Drop (rules: Players must follow the sequence)

Conditioned Game 2 (deep only)
First to 9 points (forehand): Drives with Straight Drop from the back and Straight Lob (rules: Players must play straight drives behind the line. If you are standing behind your opponent and the ball bounced on the floor, you can play a straight drop. The response after the drops must be a straight lob)
First to 9 points (forehand): Drives with Volley Straight Drop and Straight Lob (rules: Players must play deep shots behind the T-line. You can play a volley straight drop if you are standing in front of your opponent. The response after the drops must be a straight lob)
Conditioned Game 3
First to 9 points (both sides): Length Game with Straight Drop from the back and Straight Lob (rules: Players must play straight drives behind the line. If you are standing behind your opponent and the ball bounced on the floor, you can play a straight drop. The response after the drops must be a straight lob)
First to 9 points (both sides): Length Game with Volley Straight Drop and Straight Lob (rules: Players must play deep shots behind the T-line. You can play a volley straight drop if you are standing in front of your opponent. The response after the drops must be a straight lob)

Conditioned Game 4
First to 11 points (both sides): Straight Lob – Deep – Short (rules: Players must follow the sequence. Deep shots must land behind the T-line. Short Can be any boasts or drops)
First to 11 points (both sides): Straight Lob – Deep with Kills – Short (rules: Players must follow the sequence. Deep shots must have their second bounce landing behind the T-line. Short can be any boasts or drops)

Conditioned Game 5
First to 11 points: Free Game

End of session.

Focus: Mastering Backhand Straight Game Strategy and Execution within Defined Frontwall Zones, specifically targeting different shot heights from low to high.
Rest time between exercises: 1min30sec

WARM-UP (10min)
2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

SESSION
Conditioned Game 1
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives (rules: Player A can play on Zone 1 and Zone 2. Player B can use Zone 2 and Zone 3)
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives (rules: Player A can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can use Zone 1 and Zone 2)

Conditioned Game 2
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Volley Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A can play volley straight drop.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Volley Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can play volley straight drop.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
Conditioned Game 3
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
Conditioned Game 4
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Drop and Counter (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob or a counter drop)
First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Drop and Counter (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob or a counter drop)
Conditioned Game 5
First to 11 points (backhand): Alley Game
End of session.

INSTRUCTIONS
Definition of Zones on the Front Wall – When you look at the front wall you could separate it into 3 different zones:
The bottom one (Zone 1) ⇒ Drop, kill, very hard drive area
The middle one (Zone 2) ⇒ Normal and deep drive area
The top one (Zone 3) ⇒ Lob area

question: Design a 60-minute squash session to improve my straight game
answer:
Duration: 60 min
Session Focus: Improving Straight Game Control
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up  (total 10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast–Drive–Drop–Drive
2. 2min30sec: Boast–Drive sequence while keeping the same positions
3. Repeat correcting the roles

Session
Condition Game 1
• 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives (First bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the service line and the service box alley)
• 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives (First bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the service line and in the service box alley)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 2
• 7 points (forehand): Drives No Volleys (Each player has to place at least one foot on the T line after hitting their shot. If a player hits a shot and did not go back to the t-line before then the point is automatically lost. Kills are allowed)
• 7 points (backhand): Drives No Volleys (Each player has to place at least one foot on the T line after hitting their shot. If a player hits a shot and did not go back to the t-line before then the point is automatically lost. Kills are allowed)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 3
• 7 points (forehand): Drives with 1 Drop (First bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley. Once per rally you can play a straight drop in front of the service line. All other shots must be deep)
• 7 points (backhand): Drives with 1 Drop (First bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley. Once per rally you can play a straight drop in front of the service line. All other shots must be deep)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 4
• 11 points (forehand): Alley Game
• 11 points (backhand): Alley Game
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 5
• 11 points: Free Game (Each player can accumulate double points if they manage to squeeze their opponent with a straight shot)

End of session.

question: Design a 60-minute squash session to improve my straight game
answer:
Duration: 60 min
Session Focus: Mastering Straight Game Control and execution in different scenarios.
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up  (total 10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive 
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions)

Session
Condition Game 1 (12 min)
• 7 points: Drives (Forehand) (Rule: First bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley)
• 7 points: Drives (Backhand) (Rule: First bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 2 (14 min)
• 7 points: Drives No Volleys (Forehand) (Rule: Each player has to place at least one foot on the T line after hitting their shot. Kills are allowed.) 
• 7 points: Drives No Volleys (Backhand) (Rule: Each player has to place at least one foot on the T line after hitting their shot. Kills are allowed.)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 3 (14 min)
• 7 points: Drives with 1 Drop (Forehand) (Rule: First bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley. Once per rally you can play a straight drop in front of the service line. All other shots must be deep)
• 7 points: Drives with 1 Drop (Backhand) (Rule: First bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley. Once per rally you can play a straight drop in front of the service line. All other shots must be deep)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 4 (22 min)
• 11 points: Alley Game (Forehand)
• 11 points: Alley Gaming (Backhand)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 5 (11 min)
• 11 points: Free Game (Rule: If you squeeze your opponent with a straight shot, i.e. the ball was too tight against the side wall, then you win 2 points)

End of session.

First to 11 points: Free Game

End of session.

question: Design a 60-minute squash session to improve my straight game
answer:
Duration: 60 minutes
Session Focus: Improving straight game control and strategy
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up (10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive 
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

Session
Condition Game 1
• 7 points: Drives (forehand, first bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley)
• 7 points: Drives (backhand, same rules)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 2 
• 7 points: Drives No Volleys (forehand, each player has to place at least one foot on the T line after hitting their shot. If a player hits a shot and did not go back to the t-line before then the point is automatically lost. Kills are allowed)
• 7 points: Drives No Volleys (backhand, same rules)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 3
• 7 points: Drives with 1 Drop (forehand, first bounce must land behind the service line and the service box alley. Once per rally you can play a straight drop in front of the service line. All other shots must be deep)
• 7 points: Drives with 1 Drop (backhand, same rules)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 4
• 11 points: Alley Game (forehand)
• 11 points: Alley Game (backhand)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 5
• 11 points: Free Game (if squeeze your opponent with a straight shot, i.e. the ball was too tight against the side wall, then you win 2 points)

End of session.

question: I need a Intermediate 45min session for 2 players.
answer:
Duration: 45min
Session Focus: Mastering high variations of deep shots from the front of the court and high variations of short shots from the back of the court. Mastering Dynamic Role Reversal via Volley Straight Interception and Strategic Counter-Dropping
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up  (total 8–10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)

Session

Condition Game 1
• 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)
• 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 2
• 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills and Volley Drive (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops. However, if Player B manages to volley, a volley straight drive can be played and both players change roles until the person in the back decides to play a volley straight drive again or the rally is over. Every rally you change the player starting at the back)
• 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills and Volley Drive (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops. However, if Player A manages to volley, a volley straight drive can be played and both players change roles until the person in the back decides to play a volley straight drive again or the rally is over. Every rally you change the player starting at the back)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.

question: My opponent is strong on the attack. Give me a session to practice my defensive game, especially my hard drive.
answer:
Duration: 90 min
Session Focus: Improving defensive play and enhancing hard drive shots
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up (Total 10 min)
1. 2min30s: Boast – Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2. 2min30s: Boast – Drive variation (Sequence: Player A drives, then plays a boast → Player B drops, then drives)
3. Repeat the above exercises with reversed roles


Session

Conditioned Game 1 (Total 12 min)
• 6 points: Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line – forehand side)
• 6 points: Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line – backhand side)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 2 (Total 12 min)
• 6 points: Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally – forehand side)
• 6 points: Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally – backhand side)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 3 (Total 12 min)
• 6 points: Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally – forehand side)
• 6 points: Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally – backhand side)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 4 (Total 12 min)
• 6 points: Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally – forehand side)
• 6 points: Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally – backhand side)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 5 (Total 12 min)
• 6 points: Open versus Halfcourt right side (rules: Player A can play everywhere. Player B is restricted to playing shots that land and stay within the right side of the court – forehand side)
• 6 points: Open versus Halfcourt right side (rules: Player B can play everywhere. Player A is restricted to playing shots that land and stay within the right side of the court – backhand side)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.

question: Design a 90min session to improve my volley straight drop.
answer:
Duration: 90 min
Session Focus: Improve Volley Straight Drop
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up (10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)) 
3. 5 min: Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

Session
Condition Game 1
• 9 points: Length Game with Kills (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line.)
• 9 points: Length Game with Kills and Volley Straight Drop (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If a player volleys around the T-line then this player is allowed to play a volley straight drop)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 2
• 9 points: Length Game with Kills and Short After Deep (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If a player plays a deep drive, i.e. ball bouncing on the floor then backglass, then the opponent must play a short shot. Counters are allowed)
• 9 points: Length Game with Kills  and any Volley Short (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If a player volleys around the T-line then this player is allowed to play a volley short shots(e.g. volley drops and boasts))
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 3
• 9 points: Length Game with Straight Drop from the back and Straight Lob (rules: Players must play straight drives behind the service box line. If you are standing behind your opponent and the ball bounced on the floor, you can play a straight drop. The response after the drops must be a straight lob)
• 9 points: Length Game with Volley Straight Drop and Straight Lob (rules: Players must play deep shots behind the T-line. You can play a volley straight drop if you are standing in front of your opponent. The response after the drops must be a straight lob)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 4
• 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills and Volley Drive (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops. However, if Player B manages to volley, a volley straight drive can be played and both players change roles until the person in the back decides to play a volley straight drive again or the rally is over.)
• 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills with One Counter (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Once per rally Player B can play a straight counter drop. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 5
• 11 points: Free Game

End of session.

Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

SESSION
Conditioned Game 1
First to 9 points (both sides): Length Game with Kills (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line.)
Conditioned Game 2

Conditioned Game 3
First to 9 points (both sides): Length Game with Kills and any Volley Short (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If a player volleys around the T-line then this player is allowed to play a volley short shots(e.g. volley drops and boasts)
Conditioned Game 4
First to 9 points (both sides): Length Game with Kills and Deep Shot Focus (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If a player plays 2 deep drives in a rally, i.e. ball bouncing on the floor then backglass, then the rally is automatically won)
First to 9 points (both sides): Length Game with Kills and Short After Deep (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If a player plays a deep drive, i.e. ball bouncing on the floor then backglass, then the opponent must play a short shot. Counters are allowed)

First to 11 points (both sides): Free Game

INSTRUCTIONS
Advice: Here you are expected to be smart and use combinations of shots. Without combinations the efficiency of these exercises will not be maximised. If you are unsure about the combinations you could try to do… contact your coaches :-) 
Kills: all length games are with kill allowed (2nd bounce behind the line)
Counters: Any short shots can be countered as many as the players want until someone plays a deep shot, unless specified otherwise

question: My opponent is strong on the attack. Give me a session to practice my defensive game, especially my straight drop.
answer:
Duration: 45 minutes (Warm-up: 10 min, Session: 35 min)
Session Focus: Enhancing Defensive Skills, Focusing on the Straight Drop
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up  (Total 10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots))
3. Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

Session

Conditioned Game 1
• First to 9 points (forehand): Front versus Back with Deep Shots Only (rules: Player A must play every shot first bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)
• First to 9 points (backhand): Front versus Back with Deep Shots Only (rules: Player B must play every shot first bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 2
• First to 9 points (forehand): Front versus Back with Kills and One Drive (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops, but one time per rally can play a straight drive)
• First to 9 points (backhand): Front versus Back with Kills and One Drive (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops, but one time per rally can play a volley straight drive)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 3
• First to 9 points (forehand): Front versus Back with Kills and One Volley Drive (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops, but one time per rally can play a volley straight drive)
• First to 9 points (backhand): Front versus Back with Kills and One Volley Drive (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops, but one time per rally can play a volley straight drive)

End of session.

Rest time between exercises: 1min30sec


WARM-UP (10min)
2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

SESSION
Conditioned Game 1
First to 9 points (forehand): Front versus Back with Kills (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)
First to 9 points (backhand): Front versus Back with Kills (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)

Conditioned Game 2
First to 11 points: Front versus Back with Kills and Volley Drive (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops. However, if Player B manages to volley, a volley straight drive can be played and both players change roles until the person in the back decides to play a volley straight drive again or the rally is over. Every rally you change the player starting at the back)
First to 11 points: Front versus Back with Kills and Volley Drive (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops. However, if Player A manages to volley, a volley straight drive can be played and both players change roles until the person in the back decides to play a volley straight drive again or the rally is over. Every rally you change the player starting at the back)

Conditioned Game 3
First to 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills with One Counter (rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Once per rally Player A can play a straight counter drop. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)
First to 9 points: Front versus Back with Kills with One Counter (rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Once per rally Player B can play a straight counter drop. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e. boasts and drops)


End of session.

Focus: Mastering Forehand Straight Game Strategy and Execution within Defined Frontwall Zones, specifically targeting different shot heights from low to high.
Rest time between exercises: 1min30sec



WARM-UP (10min)
2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

SESSION
Conditioned Game 1
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives (rules: Player A can play on Zone 1 and Zone 2. Player B can use Zone 2 and Zone 3)
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives (rules: Player A can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can use Zone 1 and Zone 2)

Conditioned Game 2
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Volley Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A can play volley straight drop.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Volley Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can play volley straight drop.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
Conditioned Game 3
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Drop (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob)
Conditioned Game 4
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Drop and Counter (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob or a counter drop)
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Drop and Counter (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob or a counter drop)
Conditioned Game 5
First to 11 points (forehand): Alley Game
End of session.

INSTRUCTIONS
Definition of Zones on the Front Wall – When you look at the front wall you could separate it into 3 different zones:
The bottom one (Zone 1) ⇒ Drop, kill, very hard drive area
The middle one (Zone 2) ⇒ Normal and deep drive area
The top one (Zone 3) ⇒ Lob area

Focus: master your straight drives from the front & front court movement.
Rest time between exercises: 1min30sec

Instructions: 
Straight drive technique: when hitting your straight drive, face the side wall. Avoid facing the front wall during your shot or when ghosting. Ask your coach for more tips. 
Ghosting routine: all ghosting routines focus on the front corners. Each ghost to the corner should be a 3-step movement, finishing with a lunge. Aim to return to the T in 3 steps as well.

WARM-UP (5min)
4min: Boast–Drive (Switch roles halfway)
Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A boasts → Player B drives

SESSION
Exercise 1 (9min30sec)
2x4min (forehand side): Drop - Drive (Switch roles halfway)
Player A: feeds straight drops from the back
Player B: plays straight drives (first bounce behind the service box)
Optional Target: Place a small target (e.g. wristband, a shoe, or even a ball box) on the floor, 10 to 30cm behind the service box and against the side wall. The smaller the target, the more challenging it will be! Your goal is to consistently land the first bounce of your drive directly on it. 
Exercise 2 (9min30sec)
4min (backhand side): Drop – Drive (half-time players change roles)
Player A: feeds straight drops from the back
Player B: plays straight drives (first bounce behind the service box)
Optional Target: Place a small target (e.g. wristband, a shoe, or even a ball box) on the floor, 10 to 30cm behind the service box and against the side wall. The smaller the target, the more challenging it will be! Your goal is to consistently land the first bounce of your drive directly on it. 
Exercise 3 (9min30sec)
4x2min (forehand side): Drop – FH Drive – BH Ghost (half-time players change roles)
Sequence: Player A drops to the front right corner → Player B ghosts to the front left corner, then returns to the T → Player A feeds the next drop once B is back on the T.
Player A: feeds straight drops only
Player B: plays straight drives (first bounce behind the service box) from the front then ghosts to the opposite corner in the front
Optional Target: Place a small target (e.g. wristband, a shoe, or even a ball box) on the floor, 10 to 30cm behind the service box and against the side wall

Exercise 4 (9min30sec)
2x4min (forehand side): Drop/Boast – Drive (half-time players change roles)
Player A: feeds straight drops or boast from the back
Player B: plays straight drives only (first bounce behind the service box)

question: Generate a Medium intensity session for the ['forehand', 'backhand'] that includes straight lob and counter drop.
answer:
Duration: 60 min  
Session Focus: Enhancing Control of Straight Lob and Counter Drops in both Forehand and Backhand rallies

Rest between exercises: 1min30s

**Warm-up (10 min)**  
1. 2min30sec: Boast–Drive–Drop–Drive  
2. 2min30sec: Boast–Drive 2 shots  
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

**Session**

**Condition Game 1**  
• First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Counter Drop (rules: Both players can play in frontwall Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A initiates the rally with a straight drive, and can play a counter drop if the ball bounces high. The response to the counter drop must be a straight lob)  
• First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Counter Drop (rules: Play switches with Player B initiating the rally and gaining the option for counter drops, maintaining the same constraints)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Condition Game 2**  
• First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Counter Drop (rules: Similar to the forehand practice, focusing on Zones 2 and 3 with Player A starting the rally and having the option for counter drops. The counter drop response must be a straight lob)  
• First to 7 points (backhand): Straight Drives with Counter Drop (rules: Player B switches roles and has the opportunity for counter drops under the same conditions)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Condition Game 3**  
• First to 9 points (both sides): Straight Drives with Straight Lob under Cross Conditions (rules: Each player can play the straight lob alternately when the ball approaches them in Zone 3. The lob becomes a setup for alternating drop and drive actions, increasing tactical awareness in Zone 2)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Condition Game 4**  
• First to 11 points (both sides): Drill and Drop (rules: Alternating deep drives must be used to position the opponent, with an opportunity for a counter drop coming directly after a lob. Players must focus on regaining T-dominance after each rally)  

End of session.

Ghosting routine: all ghosting routines focus on the front corners. Each ghost to the corner should be a 3-step movement, finishing with a lunge. Aim to return to the T in 3 steps as well.

question: Design a 60min session to improve my deep cross.
answer:
Duration: 60min (Warm-up: 10min + Conditioned Games: Total 50min)
Session Focus: Improving Deep Cross-court Shots
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up (10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive – Drop – Drive 
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above.

Session

Condition Game 1 (12min)
• First to 9 points: Drive – Drive – Cross (rules: players must switch their cross side every rally)
• First to 9 points: Drive – Drive – Cross with Kills (rules: players must switch their cross side every rally and kills are allowed)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 2 (12min)
• First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)
• First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 3 (10min)
• First to 11 points: Cross versus Straight (rules: Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots only)
• First to 11 points: Cross versus Straight (rules: Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots only)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 4 (16min)
• First to 15 points Free Game (rules: the response to any short shot has to be a cross lob. Win 2 points if you win the rally with a Lob - winner or unforced error)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.

question: Generate a 60minutes squash session to improve my straight drives
answer:
Duration: Warm-up (10 min) + Session (Conditioned Games: 5 x 9 min each = 45 min) = 55 min total  
Session Focus: Mastering Straight Drives on Both Sides While Integrating Specific Shot Variations  
Rest between exercises: 1 min 30 s

Warm-up (10 min total)  
1. 2 min 30 s: Boast–Drive–Drop–Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)  
2. 2 min 30 s: Boast–Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drive)  
3. 2 min 30 s: Switch roles and repeat the exercises above  

Session  

Conditioned Game 1 (9 min)  
• First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  
• First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 2 (9 min)  
• First to 9 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
• First to 9 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 3 (9 min)  
• First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep cross)  
• First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep cross)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 4 (9 min)  
• First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
• First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 5 (9 min)  
• First to 11 points: Free Game  

End of session.

First to 11 points: Free Game

End of session.

question: Generate a Medium intensity session for the ['forehand', 'backhand'] that includes volley cross and volley straight drive.
answer:
Duration: 60 min  
Session Focus: Developing volley cross and volley straight drive skills between forehand and backhand.

Rest between exercises: 1 min 30 s

Warm-up (total 10 min)
1. 2 min 30 sec: Boast – Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2. 2 min 30 sec: Boast – Cross – Boast – Drive
3. Switch roles and repeat the above exercises.

Session  
Conditioned Game 1
• First to 9 points (forehand): Volley Deep Drives (rules: all volleys must land behind the T-line after the first bounce)
• First to 9 points (backhand): Volley Deep Drives (switch sides, the same rules apply)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 2
• First to 7 points (forehand): Volley Cross Drive to Volley Straight (rules: alternate between cross and straight volleys)
• First to 7 points (backhand): Volley Cross Drive to Volley Straight (switch sides, the same rules apply)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 3
• First to 9 points (forehand): Volley Drives with Rotating Roles (rules: each point switch between volley cross and straight drive roles)
• First to 9 points (backhand): Volley Drives with Rotating Roles (switch sides, the same rules apply)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 4
• First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Volleys with Optional Drop (rules: one volley straight drop allowed per rally)
• First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Volleys with Optional Drop (switch sides, the same rules apply)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 5
• First to 11 points: Free Game (focus on integrating volleys into a normal game flow)

End of session.

Focus: master your straight drives from the front & front court movement.
Rest time between exercises: 1min30sec

Instructions: 
Straight drive technique: when hitting your straight drive, face the side wall. Avoid facing the front wall during your shot or when ghosting. Ask your coach for more tips. 
Ghosting routine: all ghosting routines focus on the front corners. Each ghost to the corner should be a 3-step movement, finishing with a lunge. Aim to return to the T in 3 steps as well.

WARM-UP (5min)
4min: Boast–Drive (Switch roles halfway)
Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A boasts → Player B drives

SESSION
Exercise 1 (9min30sec)
2x4min (forehand side): Drop - Drive (Switch roles halfway)
Player A: feeds straight drops from the back
Player B: plays straight drives (first bounce behind the service box)
Optional Target: Place a small target (e.g. wristband, a shoe, or even a ball box) on the floor, 10 to 30cm behind the service box and against the side wall. The smaller the target, the more challenging it will be! Your goal is to consistently land the first bounce of your drive directly on it. 
Exercise 2 (9min30sec)
4min (backhand side): Drop – Drive (half-time players change roles)
Player A: feeds straight drops from the back
Player B: plays straight drives (first bounce behind the service box)
Optional Target: Place a small target (e.g. wristband, a shoe, or even a ball box) on the floor, 10 to 30cm behind the service box and against the side wall. The smaller the target, the more challenging it will be! Your goal is to consistently land the first bounce of your drive directly on it. 
Exercise 3 (9min30sec)
4x2min (forehand side): Drop – FH Drive – BH Ghost (half-time players change roles)
Sequence: Player A drops to the front right corner → Player B ghosts to the front left corner, then returns to the T → Player A feeds the next drop once B is back on the T.
Player A: feeds straight drops only
Player B: plays straight drives (first bounce behind the service box) from the front then ghosts to the opposite corner in the front
Optional Target: Place a small target (e.g. wristband, a shoe, or even a ball box) on the floor, 10 to 30cm behind the service box and against the side wall

Exercise 4 (9min30sec)
2x4min (forehand side): Drop/Boast – Drive (half-time players change roles)
Player A: feeds straight drops or boast from the back
Player B: plays straight drives only (first bounce behind the service box)
Optional Target: Place a small target (e.g. wristband, a shoe, or even a ball box) on the floor, 10 to 30cm behind the service boxes and against the side walls

2min30sec: Boast – Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots)
Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

SESSION
Condition Game 1
First to 7 points: Boast – Drive (rules: Player A plays boasts under the service line only. Player B plays drives behind the T-line)
First to 7 points: Boast – Drive (rules: Player B plays boasts under the service line only. Player A plays drives behind the T-line)

Condition Game 2
First to 7 points: Boast – Drive with One Extra Drive (rules: Player A plays boasts under the service line only, but is allowed to play 1 straight drive per rally. Player B plays drives behind the T-line)
First to 7 points: Boast – Drive with One Extra Drive (rules: Player B plays boasts under the service line only, but is allowed to play 1 straight drive per rally. Player A plays drives behind the T-line)

Condition Game 3
First to 9 points: Boast – Drive with One Counter (rules: Player A plays boasts under the service line only, but can counter drop if Player B plays a drop. Player B plays drives behind the T-line , but is allowed to play 1 counter drop per rally)
First to 9 points: Boast – Drive with One Counter (rules: Player B plays boasts under the service line only,but can counter drop if Player A plays a drop. Player A plays drives behind the T-line, but is allowed to play 1 counter drop per rally)

Condition Game 4
First to 9 points:  Boast – Drive with Counters (rules: Player A plays boasts under the service line only, but can counter drop if Player B plays a drop. Player B can play a straight drive behind the line or counter drops)
First to 9 points (both sides): Boast – Drive with Counters (rules: Player B plays boasts under the service line only,but can counter drop if Player A plays a drop. Player A can play a straight drive behind the line or counter drops

Condition Game 5
First to 11 points: Free Game (rules: if squeeze your opponent with a straight shot, i.e. the ball was too tight against the side wall, then you win 2 points)

End of session.

question: My opponent is strong on the attack. Give me a session to practice my defensive game, especially my cross kill.
answer:
**Duration:** 60 minutes  
**Session Focus:** Improving defensive capabilities with an emphasis on practicing the cross kill.  
**Rest between exercises:** 1 min 30 s  

**Warm-up (10 minutes):**  
1. 2 min 30 s: Boast–Drive–Drop–Drive  
   - Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives  
2. 2 min 30 s: Boast–Drive 2 shots (keep same positions)  
   - Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drive (2 shots)  
3. Switch roles and repeat the exercises above  

**Session**  

**Conditioned Game 1**   
- First to 9 points (forehand): Front versus Back with Kills  
  - Rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e., boasts and drops  
- First to 9 points (backhand): Front versus Back with Kills  
  - Rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e., boasts and drops  

Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Conditioned Game 2**  
- First to 9 points (forehand): Front versus Back with Kills and One Drive  
  - Rules: Player A must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player B must play only short soft shots, i.e., boasts and drops, but one time per rally can play a straight drive  
- First to 9 points (backhand): Front versus Back with Kills and One Drive  
  - Rules: Player B must play every shot second bounce behind the line. Player A must play only short soft shots, i.e., boasts and drops, but one time per rally can play a straight drive  

Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Conditioned Game 3**  
- First to 9 points (forehand): Boast – Cross – Drive  
  - Rules: You must follow the pattern/sequence Boast–Cross–Drive. Kills are allowed for deep shots  
- First to 9 points (backhand): Boast – Cross – Drive  
  - Rules: You must follow the pattern/sequence Boast–Cross–Drive. Kills are allowed for deep shots  

Rest 1 min 30 s  

**End of session.**

First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Drop and Counter (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player A can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob or a counter drop)
First to 7 points (forehand): Straight Drives with Drop and Counter (rules: Both players can play on Zone 2 and Zone 3. Player B can play straight drop if the ball bounced.  The response to the volley straight drop must be a straight lob or a counter drop)
Conditioned Game 5
First to 11 points (forehand): Alley Game
End of session.

INSTRUCTIONS
Definition of Zones on the Front Wall – When you look at the front wall you could separate it into 3 different zones:
The bottom one (Zone 1) ⇒ Drop, kill, very hard drive area
The middle one (Zone 2) ⇒ Normal and deep drive area
The top one (Zone 3) ⇒ Lob area

question: 60-min conditioned game focusing on boasts and cross lobs
answer:
```markdown
Duration: 60min (warm up + session(each conditioned game = 6min))
Session Focus: Focusing on boasts and cross lobs within strategic rallies
Rest between exercises: 1min30s

Warm-up (10min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast → Player B drops and then plays a drive)
3. Switch roles and repeat the exercises above

Session

Condition Game 1
• 6min: Cross versus Straight (rules: Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots only)
• 6min: Cross versus Straight (rules: Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots only)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 2
• 6min: Cross with Boast versus Straight (rules: Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots only)
• 6min: Cross with Boast versus Straight (rules: Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots only)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Condition Game 3
• 6min: Cross with versus Straight Drives with Kills (rules: Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots excluding drops)
• 6min: Cross with versus Straight Drives with Kills (rules: Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots excluding drops)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.
```

question: 60-min conditioned game focusing on boasts and cross lobs
answer:
Duration: 60 min  
Session Focus: Mastering the Strategic Dynamics and Shot Execution in Cross-Court vs. Straight-Court Rallies  
Rest between exercises: 1 min 30 s  

Warm-up (10 min)  
1. 2 min 30 s: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive  
   - Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives  
2. 2 min 30 s: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions)  
   - Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drive (2 shots)  
3. Switch roles and repeat the exercises above  

Session  

Conditioned Game 1  
• First to 9 points: Cross versus Straight  
  - Rules: Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots only.  
• First to 9 points: Cross versus Straight  
  - Rules: Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots only.  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 2  
• First to 9 points: Cross with Boast versus Straight  
  - Rules: Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots only.  
• First to 9 points: Cross with Boast versus Straight  
  - Rules: Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots only.  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 3  
• First to 9 points: Cross with versus Straight Drives with Kills  
  - Rules: Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots excluding drops.  
• First to 9 points: Cross with versus Straight Drives with Kills  
  - Rules: Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots excluding drops.  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 4  
• First to 9 points: Open versus Straight Shots  
  - Rules: Player A can play everywhere. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots only.  
• First to 9 points: Open versus Straight Shots  
  - Rules: Player B can play everywhere. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots only.  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

End of session.

Duration: 10 min (warm-up) + 36 min (session with each conditioned game approximately 6 min)
Session Focus: Mastering Boasts and Cross Lobs

Warm-up (total 10 min)
1. 2min30sec: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive 
   - Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives.
2. 2min30sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) 
   - Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drive (2 shots).
3. Switch roles and repeat the exercises above.

Session

Conditioned Game 1
• 6 min: Cross Lobs versus Straight (Player A is restricted to playing cross lobs only. Player B is restricted to playing straight shots only.)
• 6 min: Cross Lobs versus Straight (Player B is restricted to playing cross lobs only. Player A is restricted to playing straight shots only.)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 2
• 6 min: Cross with Boast versus Cross Lobs (Player A is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player B is restricted to playing cross lobs only.)
• 6 min: Cross with Boast versus Cross Lobs (Player B is restricted to playing cross-court shots and boasts only. Player A is restricted to playing cross lobs only.)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Conditioned Game 3
• 6 min: Boast and Lob (Player A can only play boasts. Player B is restricted to playing cross lobs only.)
• 6 min: Boast and Lob (Player B can only play boasts. Player A is restricted to playing cross lobs only.)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.

answer:
Duration: 60 min  
Session Focus: Mastering Boast-Cross-Drive Patterns and Applying Boasts Strategically within a Driving Game  
Rest between exercises: 1 min 30 s  

Warm-up (total 10 min)  
1. 2 min 30 sec: Boast – Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)  
2. 2 min 30 sec: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions) (Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drives (2 shots))  
3. Switch roles and repeat the exercises above  

Session  

Conditioned Game 1  
• First to 9 points (forehand): Boast – Cross – Drive (rules: you must follow the pattern/sequence. Kills are allowed for deep shots)  
• First to 9 points (backhand): Boast – Cross – Drive (rules: you must follow the pattern/sequence. Kills are allowed for deep shots)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 2  
• First to 9 points (forehand): Boast – Cross – Drive with Counters (rules: You must follow the pattern/sequence Boast – Cross – Drive. Kills are allowed for deep shots. After a boast players can counter straight as many times as they want until someone plays the cross)  
• First to 9 points (backhand): Boast – Cross – Drive with Counters (rules: You must follow the pattern/sequence Boast – Cross – Drive. Kills are allowed for deep shots. After a boast players can counter straight as many times as they want until someone plays the cross)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 3  
• First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  
• First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 4  
• First to 9 points (forehand): Alley Game with Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If you are in front of your opponent, you can play a boast. The response after the boast must be a cross)  
• First to 9 points (backhand): Alley Game with Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If you are in front of your opponent, you can play a boast. The response after the boast must be a cross)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

End of session.

question: 60-min conditioned game focusing on boasts and cross
answer:
Duration: 60 min  
Session Focus: Strategic Application of Boasts and Cross-Court Shots

Rest between exercises: 1 min 30 s

**Warm-up (total 8–10 min)**  
1. 2 min 30 s: Boast – Drive – Drop – Drive  
   Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives  
2. 2 min 30 s: Boast – Drive 2 shots (keep same positions)  
   Sequence: Player A drives and then plays a boast (2 shots) → Player B drops and then plays a drive (2 shots)  
   Switch roles and repeat the exercises above  

**Session**

**Conditioned Game 1**  
- 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  
- 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  

Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Conditioned Game 2**  
- 9 points (forehand): Deep Drives with Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If you are in front of your opponent, you can play a boast. The response after the boast must be a deep cross)  
- 9 points (backhand): Deep Drives with Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If you are in front of your opponent, you can play a boast. The response after the boast must be a deep cross)  

Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Conditioned Game 3**  
- 9 points (forehand): Boast – Cross – Drive (rules: you must follow the pattern/sequence. Kills are allowed for deep shots)  
- 9 points (backhand): Boast – Cross – Drive (rules: you must follow the pattern/sequence. Kills are allowed for deep shots)  

Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Conditioned Game 4**  
- 11 points: Length Game with 1 Boast (rules: second bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the boast must be a deep shot)  

Rest 1 min 30 s  

**Conditioned Game 5**  
- 11 points: Free Game (rules: If you win a rally with a boast and you were in front of your opponent, you get 2 points)

End of session.

used_blocks.constraints:
### Constraints (follow strictly)

Only use these shots/labels when writing the plan (use synonyms only if they map to these):
- Allowed actions: 2-wall boast, 3-wall boast, boast, counter drop, cross, cross down the middle, cross drop, cross kill, cross lob, cross-court nick, deep cross, deep drive, drive, drop, hard cross, hard drive, lob, reverse boast, straight drive, straight drop, straight kill, straight lob, trickle boast, volley 2-wall boast, volley 3-wall boast, volley cross, volley cross drop, volley cross kill, volley cross lob, volley cross-court nick, volley deep drive, volley drive, volley hard cross, volley hard drive, volley reverse boast, volley straight drive, volley straight drop, volley straight kill, volley straight lob, wide cross

Respect these canonical sequences (per variant):
- Deep Only: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Kills Allowed: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Counter Drops: boast (initiating player)  →  ( straight drop (B) | straight drop (A) | counter drop (B) | counter drop (A) )*  →  cross (whoever chooses)  →  drive (opponent of cross)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Extra Drive: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)   # mandatory  →  optional: ( straight drive (initiating player) | straight drive (opponent) | deep drive (initiating player) | deep drive (opponent) | hard drive (initiating player) | hard drive (opponent)  )  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Open Rally via Counter Drop: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast

Interpretation mode: HYBRID (instructions + post-check).

answer:
Duration: 3 min warm-up + 30 min session (total 33 minutes)
Session Focus: Boasts and Crosses
Rest between exercises: 1 min

Warm-up (total 6 min)
1. 3 min: Dynamic Lunges and Arm Swings
2. 3 min: Ghosting Drill focusing on movement to front corners

Session
Activity Block 1: Conditioned Game 1
• 3 min: Deep Only (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
• 3 min: With Extra Drive (boast → cross → drive → optional extra drive → restart with next boast)
Rest 1 min

Activity Block 2: Conditioned Game 2
• 3 min: Deep Only (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
• 3 min: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
Rest 1 min

Activity Block 3: Conditioned Game 3
• 3 min: With Kills Allowed (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
• 3 min: Deep Only (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
Rest 1 min

Activity Block 4: Conditioned Game 4
• 3 min: With Counter Drops (boast → straight drop/counter drop → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
• 3 min: With Extra Drive (boast → cross → drive → optional extra drive → restart with next boast)
Rest 1 min

Activity Block 5: Conditioned Game 5
• 3 min: With Kills Allowed (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
• 3 min: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
Rest 1 min

End of session.

used_blocks.constraints:
### Constraints (follow strictly)

Only use these shots/labels when writing the plan (use synonyms only if they map to these):
- Allowed actions: 2-wall boast, 3-wall boast, boast, counter drop, cross, cross down the middle, cross drop, cross kill, cross lob, cross-court nick, deep cross, deep drive, drive, drop, hard cross, hard drive, lob, reverse boast, straight drive, straight drop, straight kill, straight lob, trickle boast, volley 2-wall boast, volley 3-wall boast, volley cross, volley cross drop, volley cross kill, volley cross lob, volley cross-court nick, volley deep drive, volley drive, volley hard cross, volley hard drive, volley reverse boast, volley straight drive, volley straight drop, volley straight kill, volley straight lob, wide cross

Respect these canonical sequences (per variant):
- Deep Only: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Kills Allowed: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Counter Drops: boast (initiating player)  →  ( straight drop (B) | straight drop (A) | counter drop (B) | counter drop (A) )*  →  cross (whoever chooses)  →  drive (opponent of cross)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Extra Drive: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)   # mandatory  →  optional: ( straight drive (initiating player) | straight drive (opponent) | deep drive (initiating player) | deep drive (opponent) | hard drive (initiating player) | hard drive (opponent)  )  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Open Rally via Counter Drop: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast

Interpretation mode: HYBRID (instructions + post-check).

used_blocks.archetype:
### ARCHETYPE RULES

- Description: A session that focuses on a single exercise family (e.g. Alley Games, Boast-Cross-Drive, etc...), with variants arranged in a specific order to create a logical progression (e.g., from simple to complex).

question: 60-min conditioned game focusing on boasts and cross
answer:
Duration: 48 min (Warm-up 6 min + Session 42 min)
Session Focus: Boasts and Crosses
Rest between exercises: 1 min Warm-up (total 6 min) 1. 3 min: Dynamic stretching and footwork 2. 3 min: Shadow swings focusing on boast and cross movements Session Activity Block 1 Conditioned Game 1 • Points: Deep Only (Players alternate shots, starting with a boast followed by a cross from the opponent, then the initiator plays a drive. Repeat the sequence.) Rest 1 min Conditioned Game 2 • Points: With Kills Allowed (Start with a boast, opponent plays a cross, then the initiator plays a drive. Kills are allowed in the sequence.) Rest 1 min Activity Block 2 Conditioned Game 1 • Points: With Counter Drops (Begin with a boast, either player may perform straight drops or counter drops, followed by a cross from whoever chooses, then finished with a drive. Repeat pattern with next boast.) Rest 1 min Conditioned Game 2 • Points: With Extra Drive (Sequence starts with a boast, followed by a cross, then a mandatory drive. Players can add an optional straight or deep drive before restarting with the next boast.) Rest 1 min Activity Block 3 Conditioned Game 1 • Points: Deep Only (Revisit the Deep Only sequence for reinforcement. Alternate between boast, cross, drive with next boast initiation.) Rest 1 min Conditioned Game 2 • Points: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (Sequence begins with a boast, followed by a cross and then a drive. Players can then continue into an open rally initiated by a counter drop before restarting.) Rest 1 min Activity Block 4 Conditioned Game 1 • Points: With Kills Allowed (Focus again on boasting with a cross response, followed by a drive, and allowing for opportunity to perform kills in the sequence.) Rest 1 min Conditioned Game 2 • Points: With Extra Drive (Reinforce the habit of adding an extra drive after the initial boast, cross, drive sequence. Integrate optional straight, deep, or hard drives.) Rest 1 min Activity Block 5 Conditioned Game 1 • Points: With Counter Drops (Conclude with an exercise emphasizing counter drops after the initial boast and cross. Use these in longer rallies before restarting.) Rest 1 min Conditioned Game 2 • Points: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (Final game emulates full open play post an initial boast, encouraging players to open rallies creatively with counter drops.) Rest 1 min End of session.

First to 9 points (backhand): Alley Game with 2-Wall Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. If you are in front of your opponent, you can play a 2-wall boast. The response after the boast must be a cross)
Conditioned Game 4

Conditioned Game 5
First to 11 points (both sides): Free Game (rules: If you win a rally with a 2-wall boast and you were in front of your opponent you get 2 points)
End of session.

used_blocks.constraints:
### Constraints (follow strictly)

Only use these shots/labels when writing the plan (use synonyms only if they map to these):
- Allowed actions: 2-wall boast, 3-wall boast, boast, counter drop, cross, cross down the middle, cross drop, cross kill, cross lob, cross-court nick, deep cross, deep drive, drive, drop, hard cross, hard drive, lob, reverse boast, straight drive, straight drop, straight kill, straight lob, trickle boast, volley 2-wall boast, volley 3-wall boast, volley cross, volley cross drop, volley cross kill, volley cross lob, volley cross-court nick, volley deep drive, volley drive, volley hard cross, volley hard drive, volley reverse boast, volley straight drive, volley straight drop, volley straight kill, volley straight lob, wide cross

Respect these canonical sequences (per variant):
- Deep Only: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Kills Allowed: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Counter Drops: boast (initiating player)  →  ( straight drop (B) | straight drop (A) | counter drop (B) | counter drop (A) )*  →  cross (whoever chooses)  →  drive (opponent of cross)  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Extra Drive: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)   # mandatory  →  optional: ( straight drive (initiating player) | straight drive (opponent) | deep drive (initiating player) | deep drive (opponent) | hard drive (initiating player) | hard drive (opponent)  )  →  restart pattern with next boast
- With Open Rally via Counter Drop: boast (initiating player)  →  cross (opponent)  →  drive (initiating player)  →  restart pattern with next boast

Interpretation mode: HARD (outputs will be post-checked; keep strictly compliant).

answer:
Duration: 6 min (warm-up) + 45 min (session) = 51 min total
Session Focus: Boasts and Cross

2. 3 min: Dynamic Stretching

Session

Activity Block 1
1. 3 min: Deep Only (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)

Rest 1 min 30 s

Activity Block 2

Rest 1 min 30 s

Activity Block 3

2. 3 min: With Counter Drops (boast → straight drop/counter drop* → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Activity Block 4

Rest 1 min 30 s

Activity Block 5
1. 3 min: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
2. 3 min: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (boast → cross → drive → restart with next boast)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.

question: 60-min conditioned game focusing on boasts and cross
answer:
Duration: 45 min (warm up + session)
Session Focus: Boasts and Crosses
Rest between exercises: 1 min 30 s

Warm-up (total 6 min)
1. 3 min: Dynamic Stretching
2. 3 min: Short Court Rallies

Activity Block 1 (6 min)
1. 3 min: Deep Only (Players focus on executing a boast followed by a cross, ending with a drive to restart the pattern.)
2. 3 min: Deep Only (Repeat the drill ensuring consistently deep shots and accurate boasts.)

Activity Block 2 (6 min)
1. 3 min: With Kills Allowed (Players practice the same boast-cross-drive pattern, but players are allowed to finish the rally with a kill shot.)
2. 3 min: With Kills Allowed (Switch roles and continue practicing boast-cross-drive pattern, emphasizing accuracy in kill shots.)

Activity Block 3 (6 min)
1. 3 min: With Counter Drops (Introduce the option for players to use counter drops after the boast and straight drop sequences.)
2. 3 min: With Counter Drops (Switch roles and continue, focusing on precision and positioning.)

Activity Block 4 (6 min)
1. 3 min: With Extra Drive (Incorporate additional drives after the boast and cross pattern to work on stamina and drive accuracy.)
2. 3 min: With Extra Drive (Switch roles and focus on maintaining the quality of shots as fatigue sets in.)

Activity Block 5 (6 min)
1. 3 min: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (Allow players to use counter drop variations, keeping the rally open and competitive after the boast-cross-drive pattern.)
2. 3 min: With Open Rally via Counter Drop (Switch roles and continue practicing, focusing on timing and decision-making.)

Session ends.

End of session.

Session Focus: Practicing defensive skills with emphasis on mastering deep drives and controlling rallies from the back of the court.

1. 2 min 30 s: Boast– Drive – Drop – Drive (Sequence: Player A boasts → Player B drives → Player A drops → Player B drives)

3. Switch roles and repeat the exercises above  

Session

- First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  
- First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line)  
Rest 1 min 30 s

- First to 9 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
- First to 9 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a straight drop off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 3  
- First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep cross)  
- First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Boast (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a boast off the bounce one time per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep cross)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Conditioned Game 4  
- First to 7 points (forehand): Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
- First to 7 points (backhand): Deep Drives with 1 Volley Straight Drop (rules: first bounce of the ball on the floor must land behind the T-line. Each player can play a volley straight drop per rally. The response after the drop must be a deep straight)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

End of session.

question: Design a 90min session to improve my straight lob.
answer:
Duration: 90 min  
Session Focus: Improving Straight Lob

Rest between exercises: 1 min 30 s  

Warm-up (total 8–10 min)  
1. 3 min: Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Drive-Drop-Drive + 2 shots  
2. 3 min: Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Cross-Boast-Drive + 2 shots  

Session  

Condition Game 1  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Forehand)  
  (Rule: Must be hit above the service line on the front wall.)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Switch to backhand side and roles.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Condition Game 2  
• 9 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Forehand)  
  (Rule: All cross lob shots and volley drives must have their first bounce behind the T-line.)  
• 9 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Switch sides and roles.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Condition Game 3  
• 11 pts: Conditioned Game: Drop-Drive: Drop-Drive (Deep Only) (Forehand)  
  (Rule: Drive: all drives must land first bounce behind T-line.)  
• 11 pts: Conditioned Game: Drop-Drive: Drop-Drive (Deep Only) (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Switch sides and roles.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Condition Game 4  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive Deep Only (Forehand)  
  (Rule: All shots excluding the boast must land behind the T-line.)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive Deep Only (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Switch sides and roles.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

End of session.

Session  

Condition Game 1

  (Rule: All shots excluding the boast must land behind the T-line.)

  (Rule: Every cross-court shot and the subsequent drive must involve counter drops.)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Counter Drops (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Every cross-court shot and the subsequent drive must involve counter drops.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s

• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Forehand)  
  (Rule: For the cross-court and drive shots, the second bounce of the ball must occur within the service box, allowing kill shots.)

  (Rule: All cross lob shots and volley drives must have their first bounce in the back court.)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Backhand)  
  (Rule: All cross lob shots and volley drives must have their first bounce in the back court.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

End of session.
