question: Generate a Medium intensity session for the ['backhand'] that includes straight drop and straight lob.
answer:
Sure, I can help you with that! It seems like you're trying to create a comprehensive prompt or template for designing squash training sessions. Let's walk through the key elements and ensure they are incorporated effectively:

1. **Session Structure and Goal**: Clearly specify the structure, including the warm-up and the number of Activity Blocks, as well as the goal of the session (e.g., focus on backhands, straight drops, and lobs).

2. **Exercise Details**: Define the types of exercises and their constraints, such as the point limit for conditioned games and the duration for drills. Ensure the roles switch halfway, and court sides are alternated unless deliberately focusing on one side.

3. **Hard Requirements**: Protect specific sequences (e.g., "Shot 1 – Shot 2 – Shot 3") from being altered, and ensure exercises come exclusively from an existing context.

4. **Response to Insufficient Context**: Provide a clear directive on how to respond if there aren't enough drills available in the context.

5. **Output Format**: Include duration, session focus, detailed warm-up activities, and structured Activity Blocks with specific exercises, their durations, instructions, and rest times.

You've structured your requirements well. I'll ensure the critical elements are included succinctly in the final prompt:

```markdown
Question / Goal
---------------
Generate a Medium intensity session for the ['backhand'] that includes straight drop and straight lob.

You are an elite squash coach.
Using ONLY the drills and notes in «Context», design a full training session
whose total length matches the time requested by the player
(allowed lengths: **45, 60, or 90 min**).

Hard requirements
-----------------
1. Structure: Warm-up ➜ exactly N numbered *Activity Blocks*.
2. Each Activity Block contains 1–2 exercises:
   • Exercises can be conditioned games (with points) or drills (duration).
   • Default conditioned games length ≤ 9 points.
   • Default drill length ≤ 3 min. Drill length of 4–5 min allowed only if the session is for professionals.
   • Switch player roles halfway unless specified otherwise.
   • Tend to switch court sides unless a single-side focus is specified.

3. Include a rest line after every exercise (e.g., “Rest 1 min 30 s”).
4. Re-use drill names and wording from Context whenever possible.
5. If Context lacks enough material, reply exactly: "I don't have enough drills yet."
6. Specific drill sequences formatted as "Shot 1 – Shot 2 – Shot 3" must remain unchanged.
7. Draw all warm-up and exercises in Activity Blocks from Context; do not invent anything.

Output format
-------------
Duration: <total session duration, e.g. 60 min>
Session Focus: <the theme or skill being developed, inferred from context>

Warm-up  (total 8–10 min)
1. <duration>: <drill name>
2. …

Session
Exercise 1  (<exercise duration including rest, e.g. 9 min 30 sec>)
• <duration> (<optional specific instructions, e.g., "Forehand side" or "Backhand only">): <drill name> (Switch roles halfway if applicable)
• <duration> (<optional specific instructions>): <drill name> (Switch roles halfway if applicable)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Exercise 2
• <duration> (<optional specific instructions>): <drill name> (Switch roles halfway if applicable)
• <duration> (<optional specific instructions>): <drill name> (Switch roles halfway if applicable)
Rest 1 min 30 s

...
Optional Exercise
<rules>

End of session.

Context  (do **not** edit)
--------------------------
[Context goes here]
```

Ensure the context you provide includes enough drills and details so that the session can be constructed without issues. With these instructions, you should have a structured way to craft your needed session outlines.

```
Duration: 45 min
Session Focus: Forehand and Backhand Development with Focus on Cross Kill and Straight Drive

Warm-up (total 6 min)
1. 3 min: Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Cross-Boast-Drive + 2 shots
2. 3 min: Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Drive-Drop-Drive + 2 shots

Session
Exercise 1 (9 min)
• 3 min (Forehand): Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Forehand) (Switch roles halfway)
• 3 min (Backhand): Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Backhand) (Switch roles halfway)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Exercise 2  (9 min)
• 3 min (Backhand): Drill: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Drive (Deep Only) (Backhand) (Switch roles halfway)
• 3 min (Backhand): Drill: Drop-Drive: Drop-Drive (any drive) (Backhand) (Switch roles halfway)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Exercise 3  (9 min)
• 3 min (Forehand): Drill: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Drive (Deep Only) (Forehand) (Switch roles halfway)
• 3 min (Forehand): Drill: Drop-Drive: Drop-Drive (any drive) (Forehand) (Switch roles halfway)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.
```

Session

Activity 1 (9 min 30 sec)  
• 3 min: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Forehand)  
   (Rule: Straight Lob: Must be hit above the service line on the front wall)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Forehand)   
   (Rule: For the cross-court and drive shots, the second bounce of the ball)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Activity 2 (9 min 30 sec)  
• 3 min: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Backhand)  
   (Rule: Straight Lob: Must be hit above the service line on the front wall)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Backhand)    
   (Rule: For the cross-court and drive shots, the second bounce of the ball)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Activity 3 (9 min 30 sec)  
• 3 min: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Forehand)  
   (Rule: All cross lob shots and volley drives must have their first bounce)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Forehand)    
   (Rule: All cross lob shots and volley drives must have their first bounce)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Activity 4 (9 min 30 sec)

   (Rule: All cross lob shots and volley drives must have their first bounce)  
• 7 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Backhand)   
   (Rule: All cross lob shots and volley drives must have their first bounce)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Activity 5 (9 min 30 sec)

   (Rule: Drive: The first bounce of all drives must land behind the T-line)  
• 3 min: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Forehand)   
   (Rule: For the cross-court and drive shots, the second bounce of the ball)  
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.

question: Create a training routine that helps with 'learn to use defensive cross lob to give yourself time to go back on the T'.
answer:
Duration: 45 min  
Session Focus: Learn to use defensive cross lob to give yourself time to go back on the T

Warm-up  (total 8–10 min)
1. 3 min – Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Drive-Drop-Drive + 2 shots
2. 3 min – Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Cross-Boast-Drive + 2 shots

Session  
Exercise 1  (9 min 30 sec)
• 3 min: Drill: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Backhand side, Switch roles halfway)
• 3 min: Drill: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Forehand side, Switch roles halfway)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Exercise 2  (9 min 30 sec)
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Counter Drops (Backhand side, Switch roles halfway)
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Counter Drops (Forehand side, Switch roles halfway)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Exercise 3  (9 min 30 sec)
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Forehand side, Switch roles halfway)
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast - Cross Lob - Volley Drive (Backhand side, Switch roles halfway)
Rest 1 min 30 s

Exercise 4  (9 min 30 sec)
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Backhand side, Switch roles halfway)
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Kills Allowed (Forehand side, Switch roles halfway)
Rest 1 min 30 s

End of session.

question: Generate a Medium intensity session for the ['backhand'] that includes straight drop and straight lob.
answer:
Duration: 60 min  
Session Focus: Backhand Drop and Lob Development  
Rest between exercises: 1min30s  

Warm-up (total 8–10 min)  
1. 3 min: Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Drive-Drop-Drive + 2 shots  
2. 3 min: Drill: Warmup: Compound Boast-Cross-Boast-Drive + 2 shots  

Session  

Condition Game 1  
• 9 pts: Conditioned Game: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Straight Lob: Must be hit above the service line on the front wall, ensuring precision and skill in shot selection.)  
• 11 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive Deep Only (Backhand)  
  (Rule: All shots excluding the boast must land behind the T-line to improve depth control.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Condition Game 2  
• 9 pts: Conditioned Game: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Straight Lob (Forehand)  
  (Rule: Straight Lob: Must be hit above the service line on the front wall, switching to focus on forehand execution.)  
• 11 pts: Conditioned Game: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive Deep Only (Forehand)  
  (Rule: Focus on keeping shots, excluding the boast, behind the T-line to enhance strategic play.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Condition Game 3  
• 3 min: Drill: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Drive (Deep Only) (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Drive: Ensure the first bounce of all drives lands behind the T-line to emphasize depth.)  
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Counter Drops (Backhand)  
  (Rule: Develop flexibility in shot response, emphasizing counter drops.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

Condition Game 4  
• 3 min: Drill: Drop-Drive: Volley Straight Drop - Drive (Deep Only) (Forehand)  
  (Rule: Drive: Ensure drives land deep, training forehand control under pressure.)  
• 3 min: Drill: Boast-Cross-Drive: Boast-Cross-Drive With Counter Drops (Forehand)  
  (Rule: Employ counter drops effectively to improve anticipation and response time.)  
Rest 1 min 30 s  

End of session.
